column8: Gracie Reene\
column9: and Zeus\
column10: the wolf they rescued as a pup. The three must quickly learn to master the art of magic because they have been chosen to lead Witchmaker Prep against a threat that has grim consequences.

title:text: The Word For World is Forest
description:text: When the inhabitants of a peaceful world are conquered by the bloodthirsty yumens\
column8: their existence is irrevocably altered. Forced into servitude\
column9: the Athsheans find themselves at the mercy of their brutal masters. Desperation causes the Athsheans\
column10: led by Selver\
column11: to retaliate against their captors\
column12: abandoning their strictures against violence. But in defending their lives\
column13: they have endangered the very foundations of their society. For every blow against the invaders is a blow to the humanity of the Athsheans. And once the killing starts\
column14: there is no turning back.

description:text: In 1880 Dostoevsky completed The Brothers Karamazov\
column8: the literary effort for which he had been preparing all his life. Compelling\
column9: profound\
column10: complex\
column11: it is the story of a patricide and of the four sons who each had a motive for murder: Dmitry\
column12: the sensualist\
column13: Ivan\
column14: the intellectual\
column22: the novel plunges the reader into a sordid love triangle\
column24: and a gripping courtroom drama. But throughout the whole\
column25: Dostoevsky searhes for the truth--about man\
column27: about the existence of God. A terrifying answer to man's eternal questions\
column28: this monumental work remains the crowning achievement of perhaps the finest novelist of all time. From the Paperback edition.

description:text: Dostoevsky's portrayal of the Catholic Church during the Inquisition is a plea for the power of pure faith\
column8: and a critique of the tyrannies of institutionalized religion. This is an except from the Brothers Karamazov which stands alone as a statement of philiosophy and a warning about the surrender of freedom for the sake of comfort.

description:text: Set in Mississippi during the Civil War and Reconstruction\
column8: THE UNVANQUISHED focuses on the Sartoris family\
column9: who\
column10: with their code of personal responsibility and courage\
column11: stand for the best of the Old South's traditions.

title:text: The wind's twelve quarters: Short stories
description:text: The recipient of numerous literary prizes\
column8: including the National Book Award\
column9: the Kafka Award\
column10: and the Pushcart Prize\
column11: Ursula K. Le Guin is renowned for her lyrical writing\
column12: rich characters\
column13: and diverse worlds. The Wind's Twelve Quarters collects seventeen powerful stories\
column14: each with an introduction by the author\
column15: ranging from fantasy to intriguing scientific concepts\
column16: from medieval settings to the future. Including an insightful foreword by Le Guin\
column20: this stunning collection explores human values\
column23: and showcases the myriad talents of one of the most provocative writers of our time.

title:text: To Love A Dark Stranger (Lovegram Historical Romance)
description:text: Bestselling author Colleen Faulkner's tumultuous saga of royal intrigue and forbidden desire sweeps from the magnificent estates of the aristocracy to the shadowy streets of London to King Charles II's glittering Restoration court.
Views the stars and planets from a creationist standpoint\
column8: addresses common misconceptions and difficulties about relativity and cosmology\
column9: and discusses problems with the big bang theory with many analogies\
column10: examples\
column11: diagrams\
column12: and illustrations. Original.

description:text: Covering the period from the French invasion under Napoleon into Russia. Although not covering solely the war itself\
column8: the serialized novel does cover the effects the war had on Russian society from the common person right up to the Tsar himself. The book starts to move more to a philosophical consideration on war and peace near the end making the book as a whole an important piece of literature.

description:text: Signet Classics
column9: Presents the classical epic of the Napoleonic Wars and their effects on four Russian families.

title:text: War and Peace: A Novel (6 Volumes)
description:text: Unlike some other reproductions of classic texts (1) We have not used OCR(Optical Character Recognition)\
column8: as this leads to bad quality books with introduced typos. (2) In books where there are images such as portraits\
column9: maps\
column10: sketches etc We have endeavoured to keep the quality of these images\
column11: so they represent accurately the original artefact. Although occasionally there may be certain imperfections with these old texts\
column12: we feel they deserve to be made available for future generations to enjoy.

description:text: This invaluable volume\
column8: which has been republished to commemorate the one-hundredth anniversary of Faulkner's birth\
column9: contains some of the greatest short fiction by a writer who defined the course of American literature. Its forty-five stories fall into three categories: those not included in Faulkner's earlier collections\
column10: previously unpublished short fiction\
column11: and stories that were later expanded into such novels as The Unvanquished\
column12: The Hamlet\
column13: and Go Down\
column14: Moses. With its Introduction and extensive notes by the biographer Joseph Blotner\
column15: Uncollected Stories of William Faulkner is an essential addition to its author's canon--as well as a book of some of the most haunting\
column17: and atmospheric short fiction written in the twentieth century.

description:text: In June 1862\
column8: Dostoevsky left Petersburg on his first excursion to Western Europe. Ostensibly making the trip to consult Western specialists about his epilepsy\
column9: he also wished to see first-hand the source of the Western ideas he believed were corrupting Russia. Over the course of his journey he visited a number of major cities\
column10: including Berlin\
column11: Paris\
column12: London\
column13: Florence\
column14: Milan and Vienna.His record of the trip\
column15: Winter Notes on Summer Impressions - first published in the February 1863 issue of Vremya\
column16: the periodical he edited - is the chrysalis out of which many elements of his later masterpieces developed.

title:text: Woman-The Full Story: A Dynamic Celebration of Freedoms
description:text: What does it mean to be a woman today? What have women inherited from their radical\
column8: risk-taking sisters of the past? And how does God view this half of humanity? Michele Guinness invites us on an adventure of discovery\
column9: exploring the biblical texts\
column10: the annals of history and the experiences of women today in search of the challenges and achievements\
column11: failures and joys\
column12: of women throughout the ages.

title:text: Worlds of Exile and Illusion: Three Complete Novels of the Hainish Series in One Volume--Rocannon's World\
description:text: Orb Books
column9: Worlds of Exile and Illusion contains three novels in the Hainish Series from Ursula K. Le Guin\
column10: one of the greatest science fiction writers and many times the winner of the Hugo and Nebula Awards. Her career as a novelist was launched by the three novels contained here. These books\
column11: Rocannon's World\
column12: Planet of Exile\
column13: and City of Illusions\
column14: are set in the same universe as Le Guin's groundbreaking classic\
column15: The Left Hand of Darkness. At the Publisher's request\
column16: this title is being sold without Digital Rights Management Software (DRM) applied.
